verses.verse: And it came to pass after<WH310> this, that Absalom<WH53> the son<WH1121> of David<WH1732> had a fair<WH3303> sister<WH269>, whose name<WH8034> was Tamar<WH8559>; and Amnon<WH550> the son<WH1121> of David<WH1732> loved<WH157> her.

And Amnon<WH550> was so vexed<WH3334>, that he fell sick<WH2470> for his sister<WH269> Tamar<WH8559>; for she was a virgin<WH1330>; and Amnon<WH550> thought<WH5869> it hard<WH6381> for him to do<WH6213> any thing<WH3972> to her. Amnon thought: Heb. it was marvellous, or, hidden in the eyes of Amnon

But Amnon<WH550> had a friend<WH7453>, whose name<WH8034> was Jonadab<WH3122>, the son<WH1121> of Shimeah<WH8093> David's<WH1732> brother<WH251>: and Jonadab<WH3122> was a very<WH3966> subtil<WH2450> man<WH376>.

And he said<WH559> unto him, Why art thou, being the king's<WH4428> son<WH1121>, lean<WH1800> from day<WH1242> to day<WH1242>? wilt thou not tell<WH5046> me? And Amnon<WH550> said<WH559> unto him, I love<WH157> Tamar<WH8559>, my brother<WH251> Absalom's<WH53> sister<WH269>. lean: Heb. thin from day: Heb. morning by morning

And Jonadab<WH3082> said<WH559> unto him, Lay thee down<WH7901> on thy bed<WH4904>, and make thyself sick<WH2470>: and when thy father<WH1> cometh<WH935> to see<WH7200> thee, say<WH559> unto him, I pray thee, let my sister<WH269> Tamar<WH8559> come<WH935>, and give<WH1262> me meat<WH3899>, and dress<WH6213> the meat<WH1279> in my sight<WH5869>, that I may see<WH7200> it, and eat<WH398> it at her hand<WH3027>.

So Amnon<WH550> lay down<WH7901>, and made himself sick<WH2470>: and when the king<WH4428> was come<WH935> to see<WH7200> him, Amnon<WH550> said<WH559> unto the king<WH4428>, I pray thee, let Tamar<WH8559> my sister<WH269> come<WH935>, and make<WH3823> me a couple<WH8147> of cakes<WH3834> in my sight<WH5869>, that I may eat<WH1262> at her hand<WH3027>.
Then David<WH1732> sent<WH7971> home<WH1004> to Tamar<WH8559>, saying<WH559>, Go<WH3212> now to thy brother<WH251> Amnon's<WH550> house<WH1004>, and dress<WH6213> him meat<WH1279>.

So Tamar<WH8559> went<WH3212> to her brother<WH251> Amnon's<WH550> house<WH1004>; and he was laid down<WH7901>. And she took<WH3947> flour<WH1217>, and kneaded<WH3888> it, and made cakes<WH3823> in his sight<WH5869>, and did bake<WH1310> the cakes<WH3834>. flour: or, paste

And she took<WH3947> a pan<WH4958>, and poured them out<WH3332> before<WH6440> him; but he refused<WH3985> to eat<WH398>. And Amnon<WH550> said<WH559>, Have out<WH3318> all men<WH376> from me. And they went out<WH3318> every man<WH376> from him.

And Amnon<WH550> said<WH559> unto Tamar<WH8559>, Bring<WH935> the meat<WH1279> into the chamber<WH2315>, that I may eat<WH1262> of thine hand<WH3027>. And Tamar<WH8559> took<WH3947> the cakes<WH3834> which she had made<WH6213>, and brought<WH935> them into the chamber<WH2315> to Amnon<WH550> her brother<WH251>.
And when she had brought<WH5066> them unto him to eat<WH398>, he took hold<WH2388> of her, and said<WH559> unto her, Come<WH935> lie<WH7901> with me, my sister<WH269>.

And she answered<WH559> him, Nay, my brother<WH251>, do not force<WH6031> me; for no such thing ought<WH3651> to be done<WH6213> in Israel<WH3478>: do<WH6213> not thou this folly<WH5039>. force: Heb. humble me no such: Heb. it ought not so to be done

And I, whither shall I cause my shame<WH2781> to go<WH3212>? and as for thee, thou shalt be as one<WH259> of the fools<WH5036> in Israel<WH3478>. Now therefore, I pray thee, speak<WH1696> unto the king<WH4428>; for he will not withhold<WH4513> me from thee.
Howbeit he would<WH14> not hearken<WH8085> unto her voice<WH6963>: but, being stronger<WH2388> than she, forced<WH6031> her, and lay<WH7901> with her.

Then Amnon<WH550> hated<WH8130> her exceedingly<WH3966> <WH1419>; so that the hatred<WH8135> wherewith he hated<WH8130> her was greater<WH1419> than the love<WH160> wherewith he had loved<WH157> her. And Amnon<WH550> said<WH559> unto her, Arise<WH6965>, be gone<WH3212>. exceedingly: Heb. with great hatred greatly

And she said<WH559> unto him, There is no cause<WH182>: this evil<WH7451> in sending me away<WH7971> is greater<WH1419> than the other<WH312> that thou didst<WH6213> unto me. But he would<WH14> not hearken<WH8085> unto her.
Then he called<WH7121> his servant<WH5288> that ministered<WH8334> unto him, and said<WH559>, Put<WH7971> now this woman out<WH2351> from me, and bolt<WH5274> the door<WH1817> after<WH310> her.

And she had a garment<WH3801> of divers colours<WH6446> upon her: for with such robes<WH4598> were the king's<WH4428> daughters<WH1323> that were virgins<WH1330> apparelled<WH3847>. Then his servant<WH8334> brought<WH3318> her out<WH2351>, and bolted<WH5274> the door<WH1817> after<WH310> her.

And Tamar<WH8559> put<WH3947> ashes<WH665> on her head<WH7218>, and rent<WH7167> her garment<WH3801> of divers colours<WH6446> that was on her, and laid<WH7760> her hand<WH3027> on her head<WH7218>, and went<WH3212> on<WH1980> crying<WH2199>.

And Absalom<WH53> her brother<WH251> said<WH559> unto her, Hath Amnon<WH550> thy brother<WH251> been with thee? but hold now thy peace<WH2790>, my sister<WH269>: he is thy brother<WH251>; regard<WH7896> <WH3820> not this thing<WH1697>. So Tamar<WH8559> remained<WH3427> desolate<WH8074> in her brother<WH251> Absalom's<WH53> house<WH1004>. Amnon: Heb. Aminon regard: Heb. set not thy heart desolate: Heb. and desolate
But when king<WH4428> David<WH1732> heard<WH8085> of all these things<WH1697>, he was very<WH3966> wroth<WH2734>.

And Absalom<WH53> spake<WH1696> unto his brother Amnon<WH550> neither good<WH2896> nor bad<WH7451>: for Absalom<WH53> hated<WH8130> Amnon<WH550>, because<WH1697> he had forced<WH6031> his sister<WH269> Tamar<WH8559>.

And it came to pass after two full<WH3117> years<WH8141>, that Absalom<WH53> had sheepshearers<WH1494> in Baalhazor<WH1178>, which is beside Ephraim<WH669>: and Absalom<WH53> invited<WH7121> all the king's<WH4428> sons<WH1121>.

And Absalom<WH53> came<WH935> to the king<WH4428>, and said<WH559>, Behold now, thy servant<WH5650> hath sheepshearers<WH1494>; let<WH3212> the king<WH4428>, I beseech thee, and his servants<WH5650> go<WH3212> with thy servant<WH5650>.

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to Absalom<WH53>, Nay, my son<WH1121>, let us not all now go<WH3212>, lest we be chargeable<WH3513> unto thee. And he pressed<WH6555> him: howbeit he would<WH14> not go<WH3212>, but blessed<WH1288> him.
Then said<WH559> Absalom<WH53>, If not, I pray thee, let my brother<WH251> Amnon<WH550> go<WH3212> with us. And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto him, Why should he go<WH3212> with thee?
But Absalom<WH53> pressed<WH6555> him, that he let Amnon<WH550> and all the king's<WH4428> sons<WH1121> go<WH7971> with him.

Now Absalom<WH53> had commanded<WH6680> his servants<WH5288>, saying<WH559>, Mark<WH7200> ye now when Amnon's<WH550> heart<WH3820> is merry<WH2896> with wine<WH3196>, and when I say<WH559> unto you, Smite<WH5221> Amnon<WH550>; then kill<WH4191> him, fear<WH3372> not: have not I commanded<WH6680> you? be courageous<WH2388>, and be valiant<WH1121> <WH2428>. have: or, will you not, since I have commanded you? valiant: Heb. sons of valour

And the servants<WH5288> of Absalom<WH53> did<WH6213> unto Amnon<WH550> as Absalom<WH53> had commanded<WH6680>. Then all the king's<WH4428> sons<WH1121> arose<WH6965>, and every man<WH376> gat him up<WH7392> upon his mule<WH6505>, and fled<WH5127>. gat: Heb. rode

And it came to pass, while they were in the way<WH1870>, that tidings<WH8052> came<WH935> to David<WH1732>, saying<WH559>, Absalom<WH53> hath slain<WH5221> all the king's<WH4428> sons<WH1121>, and there is not one<WH259> of them left<WH3498>.
Then the king<WH4428> arose<WH6965>, and tare<WH7167> his garments<WH899>, and lay<WH7901> on the earth<WH776>; and all his servants<WH5650> stood<WH5324> by with their clothes<WH899> rent<WH7167>.

And Jonadab<WH3122>, the son<WH1121> of Shimeah<WH8093> David's<WH1732> brother<WH251>, answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, Let not my lord<WH113> suppose<WH559> that they have slain<WH4191> all the young men<WH5288> the king's<WH4428> sons<WH1121>; for Amnon<WH550> only is dead<WH4191>: for by the appointment<WH6310> of Absalom<WH53> this hath been determined<WH7760> from the day<WH3117> that he forced<WH6031> his sister<WH269> Tamar<WH8559>. appointment: Heb. mouth determined: or, settled

Now therefore let not my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> take<WH7760> the thing<WH1697> to his heart<WH3820>, to think<WH559> that all the king's<WH4428> sons<WH1121> are dead<WH4191>: for Amnon<WH550> only is dead<WH4191>.

But Absalom<WH53> fled<WH1272>. And the young man<WH5288> that kept the watch<WH6822> lifted up<WH5375> his eyes<WH5869>, and looked<WH7200>, and, behold, there came<WH1980> much<WH7227> people<WH5971> by the way<WH1870> of the hill<WH2022> side<WH6654> behind<WH310> him.

And Jonadab<WH3122> said<WH559> unto the king<WH4428>, Behold, the king's<WH4428> sons<WH1121> come<WH935>: as thy servant<WH5650> said<WH1697>, so it is. as thy: Heb. according to the word of thy servant

And it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end<WH3615> of speaking<WH1696>, that, behold, the king's<WH4428> sons<WH1121> came<WH935>, and lifted up<WH5375> their voice<WH6963> and wept<WH1058>: and the king<WH4428> also and all his servants<WH5650> wept<WH1058> very<WH3966> sore<WH1065> <WH1419>. very: Heb. with a great weeping greatly

But Absalom<WH53> fled<WH1272>, and went<WH3212> to Talmai<WH8526>, the son<WH1121> of Ammihud<WH5991> <WH5989>, king<WH4428> of Geshur<WH1650>. And David mourned<WH56> for his son<WH1121> every day<WH3117>. Ammihud: or, Ammihur
So Absalom<WH53> fled<WH1272>, and went<WH3212> to Geshur<WH1650>, and was there three<WH7969> years<WH8141>.

And the soul of king<WH4428> David<WH1732> longed<WH3615> to go forth<WH3318> unto Absalom<WH53>: for he was comforted<WH5162> concerning Amnon<WH550>, seeing he was dead<WH4191>. longed: or, was consumed
